intro: Rhododendron reticulatum var. hidekokubuanum, commonly known as the Hidokubu rhododendron, is a rare and ornamental evergreen shrub native to Japan. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partially shaded to sunny conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to white, bloom in late spring to early summer. This variety is prized for its compact growth habit and unique floral display, making it a sought-after specimen in botanical gardens and specialized collections.
